revision.text:
{{italic title}} {{Infobox play | name = China Doll | image = | alt = | caption = | writer = [[David Mamet]] | chorus = | characters = Mickey Ross
Carson | mute = | setting = [[Manhattan]] [[apartment]] | premiere = 2015 | place = [[Broadway theatre|Broadway]] | orig_lang = English | series = | subject = | genre = [[Drama]] | web = }} '''''China Doll''''' is a two-act play by [[David Mamet]] about political corruption and brutal violence. The play opened on Broadway at the end of 2015 with a short run scheduled to close at the end of January 2016. The two-act play contains only two characters who appear on stage throughout the play, Mickey and Carson. ==Plot== ===Act One=== Mickey is an elderly retiring political operative and political fixer in the USA who is planning an elaborate May–December wedding to a young fiancé who is a British national citizen. Mickey is planning to retire in style with his great wealth by arranging for the purchase of a luxurious private jet made in Switzerland for himself and his soon-to-be wife. An entanglement arises when Mickey receives a telephone call in his office indicating that the $5 million tax-saving scheme he has planned for his private jet purchase has gone sour. The foreign Swiss jet was supposed to fully stay out of the USA for six months for the $5 million tax-saving scheme to succeed. An apparently trivial malfunction caused the jet to land temporarily on USA soil, thus seemingly invalidating Mickey's tax-saving scheme. Not only that, but after the jet finally arrives at its original destination in Toronto, its single passenger, his fiancé, is subjected to a full strip search while being refused entry into Canada. Mickey goes ballistic when he receives this telephone report in his office. He threatens to renege on delivery of the jet on which he still has not fully signed-off, and he suspects mischief from a new political candidate and contender in the USA with whom he has a history. Mickey begins to suspect that the new candidate, known to him as "the Kid", is the source of upsetting Mickey's $5 million tax saving scheme, and for causing the false report in Toronto which caused his fiancé to be denied entry in Canada and to be strip searched. ===Act Two=== By the next morning, Mickey realizes that he may have overplayed his hand in lashing out against the jet manufacturer, against his assistant Carson, and against the political operatives of "the Kid". "The Kid" is likely to be the next governor of his State, with many inside ties and favors coming his way from the Federal government by way of "the Kid's" inside government connections. Mickey's worst nightmare comes true when he receives a phone call in his office telling him that "the Kid" has pulled in his Federal government "favors" in order to get Mickey formally charged with a Federal indictment for violation and conspiracy against the [[Foreign Corrupt Practices Act]], since the jet purchase he was arranging originated under Swiss manufacture from a Swiss contract. Mickey's only life-line is a dirty-secrets political file he has kept on "the Kid's" family of political office holders, and Mickey uses it to make a plea deal on the phone to "buy" himself out of the Federal Indictment on him against the [[Foreign Corrupt Practices Act]]. The deal requires his assistant, Carson, to play along, since Federal marshals have already been dispatched to arrest Mickey. Carson decides that Mickey is not to be trusted, and that Mickey will sell Carson out as part of Mickey's own plea deal. Carson resolves to abscond with Mickey's dirty-secrets political file right under Mickey's eyes, in order to let himself make his own exonerating plea deal for himself. Mickey gets the jump on Carson before Carson can get out the door and mortally bludgeons him with a heavy-gauge metallic scale model of the jet which he was about to purchase. As the dispatched federal marshalls are heard knocking at his office door, Mickey reverses his tactics once again and starts self-inflicting bloody wounds on his own body while shouting to the federal marshals standing outside his door, "Help me. Will... Will... Oh my God. Will no one help an old man...?", at the final curtain as the play ends. ==List of characters== *'''Mickey''', a retiring elderly political operative and political fixer. *'''Carson''', his in-office assistant and secretary. Several off-stage characters are portrayed as participating in telephone conversation with Mickey while Mickey is in his private office whose voices are not heard during the play, but only inferred by Mickey's interaction with them while speaking into his telephone on stage. ==Production== The play began previews on [[Broadway theatre|Broadway]] at the [[Gerald Schoenfeld Theatre]] on October 21, 2015 with the official opening originally scheduled for November 19.{{cite web|author=Cox, Gordon|url=https://variety.com/2015/legit/news/al-pacino-china-doll-dates-broadway-1201465326/|title=Al Pacino in ‘China Doll’ Sets Dates for Broadway|work=[[Variety (magazine)|Variety]]|date=April 2, 2015}} On November 9, 2015, the producers announced that the official opening was moved to December 4, 2015, stating "The move allows the creative team additional time to work on the play before its world premiere."{{cite web|author=Viagas, Robert|url=http://www.playbill.com/news/article/with-more-work-needed-david-mamet-drama-china-doll-starring-al-pacino-delays-opening-370849#|title=With More Work Needed, David Mamet Drama 'China Doll', Starring Al Pacino, Delays Opening|work=[[Playbill]]|date=November 9, 2015}} The play opened on December 4, 2015 in a limited engagement for 97 performances.{{cite web|author=Viagas, Robert|url=http://www.playbill.com/news/article/david-mamet-drama-china-doll-starring-al-pacino-opens-on-broadway-374036#|title=David Mamet Drama 'China Doll', Starring Al Pacino, Opens on Broadway|work=[[Playbill]]|date=December 4, 2015}} [[Al Pacino]] plays [[billionaire]] "Mickey Ross" and [[Christopher Denham]] plays his assistant "Carson" in the two-character play.{{cite news|last1=Ng|first1=David|title=Al Pacino will star in new David Mamet play|url=http://www.latimes.com/entertainment/arts/culture/la-et-cm-al-pacino-david-mamet-broadway-20141016-story.html|accessdate=28 July 2015|publisher=[[Los Angeles Times]]|date=16 October 2014}}{{cite news|title=David Mamet's 'China Doll' Adds Fran Kranz Opposite Pacino|url=https://www.nytimes.com/aponline/2015/04/02/arts/ap-us-theater-china-doll.html?_r=0|accessdate=28 July 2015|agency=AP|publisher=The New York Times|date=2 April 2015}}{{cite web|author=Gans, Andrew|author2=Viagas, Robert|url=http://www.playbill.com/news/article/christopher-denham-replaces-fran-kranz-in-china-doll-starring-al-pacino-david-mamet-play-extends-run-358394#|title=Christopher Denham Replaces Fran Kranz in 'China Doll', Starring Al Pacino; David Mamet Play Extends Run|work=[[Playbill]]|date=August 19, 2015}} The play is directed by [[Pam MacKinnon]], with scenery by [[Derek McLane]], lighting by Russell H. Champa and costumes by [[Jess Goldstein]]. Pacino said of his character and the play: "...'one of the most daunting and challenging roles I've been given to explore onstage. It's a special gift to originate a role in the theatre, especially written by such a formidable writer, and I haven't done that in a long, long time...' "{{cite web|author=Gans, Andrew|author2=Viagas, Robert|url=http://www.playbill.com/news/article/tix-to-al-pacinos-broadway-return-in-david-mamets-china-doll-on-sale-today-350707#|title=Tix to Al Pacino's Broadway Return in David Mamet's 'China Doll' On Sale Today|work=[[Playbill]]|date=June 5, 2015}} On January 21, 2016, ''Playbill'' reported that the producer of the play Jeffrey Richards summarized the short-run on Broadway stating: "It’s been ultimately very rewarding because of the work that’s been done during the actual run of the play. The ending has been changed by the playwright, and the audiences have embraced it recently, which has been very encouraging."{{cite web|title=David Mamet's China Doll, Starring Al Pacino, Turns a Profit|author=Viagas, Robert|date=January 21, 2016|work=[[Playbill]]|url=http://www.playbill.com/news/article/david-mamets-china-doll-starring-al-pacino-turns-a-profit-381355#sthash.MfuvFVXj.dpuf}} ==Reception== Critical reception for ''China Doll'' has been largely negative. [[Michael Riedel (journalist)|Michael Riedel]], theatre columnist for the ''[[New York Post]]'' called it a "terrible new play"... "Preview audiences are having none of it. The exodus at intermission is practically a stampede, and sources say some have angrily demanded refunds."{{cite web|last=Riedel |first=Michael |url=https://nypost.com/2015/10/29/al-pacino-totally-lost-over-his-terrible-new-broadway-play/ |title=Al Pacino needs teleprompters for lines in terrible new Broadway play|work=[[New York Post]] |date=2015-10-29 |accessdate=2015-10-30}} After a retooling of the play, the December 2015 review in ''[[The New York Times]]'' said "One of the biggest problems (though not the only one) in comprehending ''China Doll'' is that Mr. Pacino's lurching, stammering performance is not easy to follow in terms of content, character or subtext. There has been more than enough evidence in the past to certify that Mr. Pacino is a bona fide genius, so let's assume that there are reasons for what he's doing here."{{cite web|work=[[The New York Times]]|url=https://www.nytimes.com/2015/12/04/theater/review-in-david-mamets-china-doll-al-pacino-as-an-urban-warrior-in-winter.html |title=Review: In David Mamet’s ‘China Doll,’ Al Pacino as an Urban Warrior in Winter|author=Brantley, Ben|date=December 3, 2015}} In January 2016 review of the play, ''[[PopMatters]]'' magazine wrote "For all of its follies, ''China Doll'', which has a limited run at [[Manhattan]]'s Gerald Schoenfeld Theatre, is unlike anything Mamet has written before", and "In the abstract ''China Doll'' sounds like a rigorous but doable challenge; in performance, the play outstays its welcome. This two scene and nearly two hour play has, at most, enough dramatic momentum for one act."{{cite web|work=[[PopMatters]]|title=David Mamet and Al Pacino's 'China Doll' Rat-a-Tats Without the Tat|author=Ezell, Brice|date=26 January 2016|url=http://www.popmatters.com/column/david-mamet-and-al-pacinos-china-doll-rat-a-tats-without-the-tat/}} ''Variety'' magazine in May 2016 summarized ''China Doll'' as having suffered from "bad-buzz" media coverage once plans for Mamet's new 2017 play were announced stating: "David Mamet's first play following the bad-buzz magnet ''China Doll'' has been added to the 2016–17 season at the Atlantic Theater Company, the Off Broadway troupe that Mamet co-founded... Details are scarce on the latest from Mamet, whose Broadway outing ''China Doll'' stirred up controversy and crummy word of mouth earlier this season but still turned a profit. The untitled new play, to be directed by Atlantic artistic director Neil Pepe, is described as written 'specifically for Atlantic’s ensemble,' and will run February through April on the theater's mainstage, with exact dates to be set."Gordon Cox. [https://variety.com/2016/legit/news/atlantic-theater-company-2016-17-season-1201781028/ "David Mamet, Rebecca Hall Join 2016–17 Season at Atlantic Theater Company"]. ''Variety'' magazine. May 21, 2016. ==References== {{reflist|30em}} ==External links== *[http://www.ibdb.com/Production/View/500236 ''China Doll'' Internet Broadway Database] {{David Mamet}} [[Category:2015 plays]] [[Category:Plays by David Mamet]] [[Category:American plays]] [[Category:Two-handers]]

revision.text:
'''Continuará…''' was a [[fan convention]] for fans of [[comics]], [[anime]], [[role-playing games]], [[fantasy]] and [[strategy games]], among others.
The event took place in [[Montevideo]], [[Uruguay]], and was usually held on the second week of November. The first one took place on 24 and 25 November 2007, and attracted more than 1,000 participants.<ref name="elpais" />
==Activities== The main focus of "Continuará..." were activities such as [[Quizzes]], a [[Cosplay]] contest, a [[Karaoke]] contest, [[Paintball]] and a massive [[Twister (game)|Twister]] competition.
==The focal myth== Every year "Continuará..." adopted a popular myth as theme of the event. In 2007 they used the myth of "[[King Arthur]] and the [[Round Table]]"<ref>[http://www.continuara.com.uy//menu_02_2007.html Primer evento de "Continuará..."]</ref> and for 2008 the chosen myth was "The trials of [[Hercules]]".<ref name="elpais">[http://www.elpais.com.uy/08/09/26/pespec_372021.asp Segundo "Continuará..." en noviembre de 2008]</ref><ref>[http://www.continuara.com.uy//menu_02_2008.html Las pruebas de Hércules]</ref> The third occasion was in 2009: "Vampire chronicles".<ref>[http://www.continuara.com.uy//menu_02_2009.html Crónicas de Vampiros]</ref> The fourth and, so far, last convention was held in November 2010.<ref>[http://www.elpais.com.uy/101113/pespec-528350/espectaculos/La-cuarta-edicion-de-Continuara-en-el-Palacio/ La cuarta edición de "Continuará" en el Palacio]</ref>
== Notes== {{reflist}}
==See also== * [[Caballeros de Montevideo]], Uruguayan roleplaying games organization. * [[Montevideo Comics]], Uruguay's first comic book (and related activities) convention.
==External links== *[http://www.continuara.com.uy// Official web of "Continuará..." (Spanish)]
{{Multigenre conventions in North and South America}}
{{DEFAULTSORT:Continuara...}} [[Category:Defunct multigenre conventions]] [[Category:Role-playing conventions]] [[Category:Fan conventions]] [[Category:Entertainment in Uruguay]] [[Category:2007 establishments in Uruguay]] [[Category:Recurring events established in 2007]] [[Category:Annual events in Uruguay]]

revision.text:
{{Infobox video game | title = Dead to Rights: Retribution | image = Dead to Rights Retribution.jpg | caption = | developer = [[Volatile Games]] | publisher = [[Namco Bandai Games]] {{efn|Released under the [[Namco]] brand name.}} | composer = Richard Blackley
Edward Hargrave | series = ''[[Dead to Rights (series)|Dead to Rights]]'' | platforms = [[PlayStation 3]], [[Xbox 360]] | released = {{Video game release|EU|April 23, 2010{{cite web | url=http://www.eurogamer.net/articles/dead-to-rights-retribution-dated_1 | title=Dead to Rights Retribution dated | author=Robert Purchese | publisher=[[Eurogamer]] | date=March 18, 2010}}|AU|April 23, 2010|NA|April 27, 2010|KOR|April 29, 2010|JP|July 8, 2010}} | genre = [[Action game|Action]] | modes = [[Single-player]] }} '''''Dead to Rights: Retribution''''' is a [[Third-person (video games)#Third-person view games|third-person]] [[action game|action video game]]. It is the reboot of the ''[[Dead to Rights]]'' franchise featuring Grant City police officer Jack Slate and his [[domestic dog|canine]] companion Shadow. Developed by [[Volatile Games]] and published by [[Bandai Namco Entertainment|Namco Bandai Games]] under the Namco label for the [[Xbox 360]] and [[PlayStation 3]], the game was released in April 2010 (or July in Japan).{{cite web | url=http://www.gamespot.com/articles/dead-to-rights-retribution-first-look/1100-6208757/ | title=Dead to Rights Retribution First Look | author=Brian Ekberg | publisher=[[GameSpot]] | date=April 28, 2009 | accessdate=March 28, 2016}}{{cite web | url=http://kotaku.com/5160044/dead-to-rights-retribution-coming-this-year | title=Dead to Rights: Retribution Coming This Year | author=Brian Crecente | publisher=[[Kotaku]] | date=February 25, 2009 | accessdate=April 29, 2009}} ==Plot== The game begins with Jack collapsing on a dock after disembarking from a tugboat, and is confronted by members of the Grant City Triad, who intend to kill him as revenge for earlier events. Shadow, Jack's dog, brutally kills all of the Triad members who try to attack Jack on his way to a bar where he meets his friend, an EMT named Faith Sands, and goes into the story of what happened in the game. He flashes back to a terrorist takeover of Temple Tower, where he disobeys orders from Captain Inness and charges in, killing members of the Union gang, saving hostages and pursuing Riggs, the leader of the gang, to the roof where he escapes via a futuristic helicopter. Jack believes Riggs has military training after seeing how the Union were armed and organized. Jack is saved from Inness firing him by SWAT Captain Redwater, who is a friend of Jack and his father, Frank Slate, who takes Jack and Shadow to investigate a lead on Riggs. They discover plans and simulated versions of the Temple Tower studio, and are drawn into a gunfight when Redwater arrives with the SWAT. After holding out until more SWAT teams arrive, Frank and Jack pursue Riggs and a Triad member, splitting up to do so. Jack succeeds in arresting the Triad, but finds Frank mortally wounded nearby. Faith arrives and tries to save Frank, but fails, and Jack storms off after beating up the Triad brutally and goes to find out why his father was killed. He stops an attempted Triad bombing at Grant City Central, defeats their leader, Tseng, in hand-to-hand combat, and then returns to the area where his father was killed. He discovers that Riggs is a member of the newly formed GAC (Grant City Anti Crime Unit), which was formed by Julian Temple and now approved by the city to deal with crime in ways that go against standard ethics and protocol. Jack fights his way past GAC soldiers and destroys GAC dropships, but is knocked out by Redwater, who kills Riggs after hearing a recorded conversation between Temple and Riggs, who plot to kill Redwater. Jack manages to escape the slowly rising dropship he and Redwater are on, and Redwater's fate is left unknown when the C4 Jack attached to the ship detonates while being tossed away by Redwater. The game picks up at the bar, where Jack reveals that he detects Faith has deceived him, and she admits she was persuaded by the GAC to help locate him. Faith is wounded by a sniper, and Jack manages to evacuate her on a helicopter she called before being shot, and is dropped off at Temple Tower, where he arrests Temple, who tries to bribe him into letting him go by revealing that Redwater killed Frank, choosing to follow his father's way instead of killing Temple in cold blood. He takes Temple to the precinct he and his father work at, and discovers all regular and SWAT officers have been imprisoned for resisting GAC control. Jack imprisons Temple and frees the officers, who help to free the precinct and call patrol officers back to fight off attacking GAC troops-with help from Captain Inness, who is now glad to work Jack's way and even sends out the transmission to call for backup. Jack takes a dead GAC soldier's armor and sneaks into the GAC Alpha Base in a rundown hospital on an island. He manages to make a distraction that lets the GCPD storm the base while Jack provides sniper cover for Inness, Shadow, and a SWAT team that manages to break into the main area. Jack helps to fight off multiple GAC troops and then pursues Redwater. Jack takes control of a GAC Tank Armor and fights his way through dozens of GAC while furiously arguing with Redwater, offering him the chance to surrender like Frank would have done. Redwater refuses, stating that he did what he did for the good of the city and that Frank never would have understood, and Jack responds by fighting his way through a group of snipers as he chases Redwater on foot to a lighthouse. Redwater tries to kill Jack with a mounted machine gun, but Shadow bites Redwater's arm only to be wounded, forcing Jack to proceed alone and unarmed against Redwater, who cuts Jack across the eye with a knife and leaves a scar. Jack and Redwater fight, stealing the knife from each other repeatedly, until Jack stabs Redwater fatally, which results in him falling to his death. The game ends with Jack and Faith attending Frank's funeral, and Jack is left to look out at Grant City with Shadow next to him, promising his father he will be with him soon. ==Reception== {{Video game reviews | PS3 = true | X360 = true | na = true | Destruct_X360 = 6.5/10{{cite web | url=http://www.destructoid.com/review-dead-to-rights-retribution-174078.phtml | title=Review: Dead to Rights: Retribution (X360) | author=Joseph Leray | publisher=''[[Destructoid]]'' | date=May 20, 2010 | accessdate=March 29, 2016}} | Edge_PS3 = 6/10{{cite journal | title=Dead to Rights: Retribution | author=Edge staff | magazine=[[Edge (magazine)|Edge]] | issue=214 | date=May 2010 | page=97}} | Edge_X360 = 6/10 | EuroG_X360 = 5/10{{cite web | url=http://www.eurogamer.net/articles/dead-to-rights-retribution-review | title=Dead to Rights: Retribution (X360) | author=Dan Whitehead | publisher=Eurogamer | date=April 23, 2010 | accessdate=March 28, 2016}} | Fam_PS3 = 29/40{{cite web | url=http://nintendoeverything.com/famitsu-review-scores-94/ | title=Famitsu review scores | author=Brian | publisher=Nintendo Everything | date=June 30, 2010 | accessdate=March 28, 2016}} | Fam_X360 = 29/40 | GI_PS3 = 8/10{{cite journal | url=http://www.gameinformer.com/games/dead_to_rights_retribution/b/ps3/archive/2010/04/27/jack-is-back-in-a-reboot-we-didn-t-know-we-needed.aspx | title=Dead to Rights: Retribution: Jack Is Back In A Reboot We Didn't Know We Needed | author=Jeff Cork | magazine=[[Game Informer]] | issue=206 | date=June 2010 | page=96 | accessdate=March 28, 2016}} | GI_X360 = 8/10 | GamePro_X360 = {{Rating|3.5|5}}{{cite web | url=http://www.gamepro.com/article/reviews/214982/dead-to-rights-retribution/ | title=Dead to Rights: Retribution (X360) | author=Tae K. {{Rating|2|5}}{{cite journal | title=Review: Dead to Rights: Retribution | magazine=[[PlayStation: The Official Magazine]] | date=July 2010 | page=80}} | rev1 = ''[[The Daily Telegraph]]'' | rev1_X360 = 7/10{{cite news | url=https://www.telegraph.co.uk/technology/video-games/7682989/Dead-to-Rights-Retribution-video-game-review.html | title=Dead to Rights: Retribution video game review (X360) | author=Tom Hoggins | newspaper=[[The Daily Telegraph]] | date=May 5, 2010 | accessdate=March 28, 2016}} | rev2 = ''[[The Escapist (magazine)|The Escapist]]'' | rev2_X360 = {{Rating|3|5}}{{cite web | url=http://www.escapistmagazine.com/articles/view/video-games/editorials/reviews/7548-Review-Dead-to-Rights-Retribution | title=Review: Dead to Rights: Retribution (X360) | author=John Funk | publisher=''[[The Escapist (magazine)|The Escapist]]'' | date=May 13, 2010 | accessdate=March 28, 2016}} | MC_PS3 = 60/100{{cite web | url=http://www.metacritic.com/game/playstation-3/dead-to-rights-retribution | title = Dead to Rights: Retribution for PlayStation 3 Reviews | publisher=[[Metacritic]] | accessdate=March 28, 2016}} | MC_X360 = 61/100{{cite web | url=http://www.metacritic.com/game/xbox-360/dead-to-rights-retribution | title=Dead to Rights: Retribution for Xbox 360 Reviews | publisher=Metacritic | accessdate=March 28, 2016}} }} ''Retribution'' received "mixed" reviews on both platforms according to video game [[review aggregator]] [[Metacritic]]. In Japan, ''[[Famitsu]]'' gave it a score of one seven, one eight, and two sevens, for a total of 29 out of 40. ''[[The Daily Telegraph]]'' gave the Xbox 360 version a score of seven out of ten and said, "We all need a ''[[Die Hard (franchise)|Die Hard]]'' every now and then, and that’s exactly the kind of spirit ''Retribution'' evokes." 411Mania gave the same console version 6.9 out of 10, saying that calling it "a game that is just kind of there, and in this day and age, just being there is no longer enough."{{cite web | url=http://411mania.com/games/dead-to-rights-retribution-xbox-360-review/ | title=Dead To Rights: Retribution (Xbox 360) Review | author=Todd Vote | publisher=411Mania | date=May 17, 2010 | accessdate=March 28, 2016}} ''[[The Escapist (magazine)|The Escapist]]'' gave the same console version three stars out of five, saying, "Other than the presence of your canine sidekick, there is absolutely nothing in ''Dead to Rights: Retribution'' that hasn't been done before (and probably better) in other games." However, ''[[The A.V. Club]]'' gave the PS3 version a C−, saying, "The executions are designed to provide a was-it-good-for-you catharsis. They don’t. They come off as juvenile and obscene. Whatever shock value they might have wears off almost instantly, transforming the game’s supposed "money-shot" into something pedestrian and tedious."{{cite web | url=http://www.avclub.com/article/dead-to-rights-retribution-40686 | title=Dead To Rights: Retribution (PS3) | author=Scott Jones | publisher=''[[The A.V. Club]]'' | date=May 3, 2010 | archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20100506055706/http://www.avclub.com/articles/dead-to-rights-retribution%2C40686/ | archivedate=May 6, 2010 | deadurl=no | accessdate=March 28, 2016}} {{clear}} == References == {{reflist|30em}} ==Notes== {{notelist}} ==External links== * {{moby game|id=/dead-to-rights-retribution}} {{Dead to Rights}} [[Category:2010 video games]] [[Category:Action video games]] [[Category:Beat 'em ups]] [[Category:Bandai Namco games]] [[Category:Organized crime video games]] [[Category:PlayStation 3 games]] [[Category:Stealth video games]] [[Category:Third-person shooters]] [[Category:Video game remakes]] [[Category:Video games developed in the United Kingdom]] [[Category:Xbox 360 games]] [[Category:Video game reboots]]

revision.text:
{{Infobox video game | title = Desperate Housewives: The Game | image = Desperate Housewives The Game logo.jpg | image_size = 200px | alt = | caption = | developer = [[megazebra]] | publisher = MegaZebra | platforms = [[iOS]], [[Android (operating system)|Android]] | released = June 2017 | genre = [[Casual game|Casual]], [[Role-playing video game|role-playing game]] }}
'''''Desperate Housewives: The Game''''' is a [[Casual game|casual]] [[free-to-play]] [[Role-playing video game|role-playing]] game that was released on [[iOS]] in June 2017 by [[megazebra|MegaZebra]]. Players step into the role of a new resident, who is a popular advice columnist. By building friendships with the Housewives and other residents on [[Wisteria Lane]], the player explores her father’s past, to uncover the secret that is disrupting the idyllic life of wealthy suburbia. The game is a prequel to the [[TV series]] ''[[Desperate Housewives]]'', produced by [[ABC Studios]].<ref>{{cite web|url=http://toucharcade.com/2017/06/27/desperate-housewives-the-game-will-blend-murder-mystery-with-role-playing/|title=''Desperate Housewives: The Game'' |publisher=Common Sense Media|accessdate=September 24, 2017}}</ref>
==Gameplay== While trying to find clues to a murder, the player's character meets various housewives and earns relationship points by interacting with them; these points allows her to reach new levels. The player will also earn diamonds, which can be used to buy energy and keep playing. Completing tasks within various episodes will let the player earn money, reputation points, and energy. Furthermore, clothes and furniture will be unlocked by progressing through the game and will let the player customize and decorate.<ref>{{cite web|url=https://www.commonsensemedia.org/app-reviews/desperate-housewives-the-game|title='Desperate Housewives: The Game' Will Blend Murder-Mystery With Role-Playing|publisher=Touch Arcade|accessdate=September 24, 2017}}</ref>
==Release== ''Desperate Housewives: The Game'' was released on [[iOS]] on June 29, 2017. The [[Android (operating system)|Android]] version was released on December 1.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.megazebra.com/desperate-housewives-the-game-is-now-available-for-android-devices/|title='DESPERATE HOUSEWIVES: THE GAME IS NOW AVAILABLE FOR ANDROID DEVICES!|publisher=MegaZebra|accessdate=December 12, 2017}}</ref>
==References== {{reflist|1}}
==External links== * [http://www.megazebra.com/games/dhthegame/ Official website]

{{Infobox album | name = Electronica 2: The Heart of Noise | type = studio | artist = [[Jean Michel Jarre]] | cover = File:jmjelectronica2.jpg | alt = | released = 6 May 2016{{cite web|title=Electronica 2: The Heart of Noise |url=http://m.fans.sonymusicemail.com/nl/jsp/m.jsp?c=2e337870caa6050c68 |archive-url=https://archive.is/20160524082154/http://m.fans.sonymusicemail.com/nl/jsp/m.jsp?c=2e337870caa6050c68 |dead-url=yes |archive-date=24 May 2016 |website= |accessdate=18 February 2015 }} | recorded = 2011–2016 | venue = | studio = | genre = [[Electronic music|Electronic]] | length = 74:14 | label = [[Columbia Records|Columbia]] | producer = Jean Michel Jarre | prev_title = [[Electronica 1: The Time Machine]] | prev_year = 2015 | next_title = [[Oxygène 3]] | next_year = 2016 | misc = {{Singles | name = Electronica 2: The Heart of Noise | type = studio | single1 = The Heart of Noise, Pt. 1 | single1date = February 2016 | single2 = The Heart of Noise, Pt. 2 | single2date = February 2016 | single3 = What You Want | single3date = March 2016 | single4 = Exit | single4date = 15 April 2016 | single5 = As One | single5date = 29 April 2016 }} }} '''''Electronica 2: The Heart of Noise''''' is the eighteenth [[studio album]] of French [[electronic music]]ian and composer [[Jean Michel Jarre]], released on 6 May 2016 by [[Columbia Records]]. It is the second of a two-part album (the first being ''[[Electronica 1: The Time Machine]]'') that is based around collaborations with other electronic musicians from a wide range of decades and styles. ''Electronica 1'' included artists such as [[Vince Clarke]], [[Gesaffelstein]], [[M83 (band)|M83]], [[Armin van Buuren]], [[John Carpenter]], 3D (of [[Massive Attack]]), [[Pete Townshend]], [[Tangerine Dream]], and others, while ''Electronica 2'' includes collaborations with [[Pet Shop Boys]], [[Rone (musician)|Rone]], [[Julia Holter]], [[Primal Scream]], [[Gary Numan]], [[Hans Zimmer]], [[Edward Snowden]], [[Peaches (musician)|Peaches]], [[Sébastien Tellier]], [[The Orb]], [[Siriusmo]], [[Yello]], [[Jeff Mills]], [[Cyndi Lauper]] and [[Christophe (singer)|Christophe]].{{cite web|last1=Allen|first1=Jeremy|title=A rendezvous with electronic music pioneer Jean-Michel Jarre|url=http://www.factmag.com/2015/09/22/jean-michel-jarre-interview/|website=FACTmag.com|accessdate=3 November 2015}}{{cite web|title=Jean-Michel Jarre taps David Lynch, Julia Holter, & more for new LP|url=http://www.electronicbeats.net/feed/jean-michel-jarre-taps-david-lynch-and-julia-holter-for-new-lp/|website=Electronic Beats|accessdate=3 November 2015}} In all, the two-album collaboration has some 30 collaborators, and Jarre has described it as his "most ambitious project." The name of the album, its album art as well as its full track and collaboration listings were revealed to the public on 19 February 2016.{{cite web|last1=Kielty|first1=Martin|title=Jarre's Time Machine is 'most ambitious project'|url=https://www.teamrock.com/news/2015-09-08/jean-michel-jarre-electronica-1-time-machine-most-ambitious-project/|website=Team Rock|accessdate=3 November 2015}}{{cite web|title=Jean Michel Jarre - Electronica 2: The Heart of Noise Trailer|url=https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=Xr3l29LykUU|website=YouTube|date=19 February 2016|accessdate=19 February 2016}} revision.text:
'''Face-ism''' or '''facial prominence''' is the relative prominence of the face in the portrayal of men and women; media tend to focus more on men's faces and women's bodies.<ref>Powell, Gary N., and Laura M. Graves (3rd Edition, SAGE 2003) ''Women and Men in Management'' (page 59)</ref>
==Origin and evidence==
[[File:Face-ism Mona Lisa.svg|thumb|300px|Illustration of calculation of face-ism index on two crops of the Mona Lisa.]]
The term "face-ism" or "facial prominence" was initially defined in a 1983 study in which facial prominence was measured by a "Face-ism index", which is the ratio of two linear measurements, with the distance (in millimeters or any other unit) from the top of the head to the lowest visible point of the [[chin]] being the numerator and the distance from the top of the head to the lowest visible part of the subject's body the denominator. It was found that across societies and time, facial prominence of men has been much higher than that of women.<ref name=archer1983>{{cite journal | doi=10.1037/0022-3514.45.4.725 | issn=1939-1315 | volume=45 | issue=4 | pages=725–735 | last=Archer | first=Dane |author2=Iritani, Bonita |author3=Kimes, Debra D. |author4= Barrios, Michael | title=Face-ism: Five studies of sex differences in facial prominence | journal=Journal of Personality and Social Psychology | year= 1983}}</ref>
Subsequent studies have generated consistent findings and thus helped confirm the pervasive presence of face-ism. For instance, a prevalent face-ism phenomenon was observed in [[news magazine]]s and [[women's magazine]]s of the 1970s and 1980s.<ref>{{cite journal | doi=10.1111/j.1471-6402.1988.tb00938.x | issn=0361-6843 | volume=12 | issue=2 | pages=225–235 | last=Nigro | first=Georgia N. |author2=Hill, Dina E. |author3=Gelbein, Martha E. |author4= Clark, Catharine L. | title=Changes in the Facial Prominence of Women and Men Over the Last Decade | journal=Psychology of Women Quarterly |date=1 June 1988 }}</ref> Face-ism has been documented in [[prime-time television]] programs.<ref>{{cite journal | doi=10.1080/08838158909364075 | issn=1550-6878| volume=33 | issue=2 | pages=209–214 | last=Copeland | first=Gary A. | title=Face-ism and primetime television | journal=Journal of Broadcasting & Electronic Media | year= 1989}}</ref> Evidence has been shown that face-ism is still present in mainstream printed media from as recently as 2004, and showed that men in intellectually focused occupations tend to have higher face-to-body ratios than women in similar professions, while women in physical occupations tend to have higher face-to-body ratios than men in similar professions.<ref>{{cite journal | doi=10.1007/s11199-007-9276-3 | issn=0360-0025 | volume=57 | issue=7-8 | pages=515–525 | last=Matthews | first=Justin L. | title=Hidden Sexism: Facial Prominence and Its Connections to Gender and Occupational Status in Popular Print Media | journal=Sex Roles | date=17 August 2007 | url=https://www.academia.edu/353822/Hidden_Sexism_Facial_Prominence_and_Its_Connections_to_Gender_and_Occupational_Status_in_Popular_Print_Media}}</ref> A cross-cultural study on face-ism found that face-ism in photographs of politicians is more pronounced in gender-egalitarian societies compared to gender-unequal societies.<ref>{{cite journal | doi=10.1177/0361684312455317 | issn=0361-6843 | last=Konrath | first=Sara |author2=Au, Josephine |author3=Ramsey, Laura R. | title=Cultural Differences in Face-ism: Male Politicians Have Bigger Heads in More Gender-Equal Cultures | journal=Psychology of Women Quarterly | date=8 August 2012 | url=http://www.sarakonrath.com/media/publications/konrath_au_ramsey_2012_in_press_faceism.pdf | volume=36 | pages=476–487}}</ref>
There is no relation between face-ism and the perception of intellect.<ref name=zuckerman1994 />
==Implications==
It was found that regardless of gender difference, news photographs featuring high face prominence tend to generate more positive ratings with regard to intelligence, ambition and physical appearance than those with low face prominence.<ref name=archer1983 />
Similarly, another study argued that as a series of mental life dimensions including intelligence, personality, and character, are closely associated with the face and head; higher face-ism of men may convey impressions of greater intelligence, dominance, and control.<ref>{{cite journal | doi=10.1007/BF00987481 | issn=0191-5886 | volume=10 | issue=4 | pages=215–229 | last=Zuckerman | first= Miron | title=On the meaning and implications of facial prominence | journal=Journal of Nonverbal Behavior | date=1 December 1986}}</ref> In contrast, the greater body-ism of women (analyzed in [[Alcohol advertising|television beer commercials]]) serves to reinforce the stereotypical images of women as trophies or [[sex object]]s without personalities.<ref>{{cite journal | doi=10.1007/BF01544592 | issn=0360-0025 | volume=31 | issue=5-6 | pages=329–337 | last=Hall | first=Christine C. Iijima |author2=Crum, Matthew J. | title=Women and "body-isms" in television beer commercials | journal=Sex Roles | date=1 September 1994}}</ref>
Face-ism may not be merely restricted to gender difference but can apply to racial difference as well. For instance, the study revealed that Caucasians have higher face-ism than blacks across different media types.<ref name=zuckerman1994>{{cite journal | doi=10.1037/0022-3514.66.1.86 | issn=1939-1315 | volume=66 | issue=1 | pages=86–92 | last=Zuckerman | first=Miron |author2=Kieffer, Suzanne C. | title=Race differences in face-ism: Does facial prominence imply dominance? | journal=Journal of Personality and Social Psychology | year= 1994}}</ref>
==See also== *[[Advertising]] *[[Gender]] *[[Media bias]] *[[Sexism]] *[[Stereotypes]]
==Notes== {{reflist}}
==References== *{{cite thesis | last=Anderson | first=Beth | title=Visual Framing: A Study in Face-ism from the Websites for the 108th United States Congress | publisher=Electronic Theses and Dissertations | date=13 December 2003 |url=http://dc.etsu.edu/cgi/viewcontent.cgi?article=1982&context=etd}}
{{DEFAULTSORT:Face-Ism}} [[Category:Media studies]] [[Category:Face]] [[Category:Media bias]]

revision.text:
{{refimprove|date=July 2014}} '''Film locations in Sonoma County, California''' are a diverse set of sites throughout this [[California]] county, where all or parts of notable [[motion picture]]s have been produced.<ref>{{Cite web|title = Big Directors Who Filmed in Small Sonoma County Towns|url = http://www.sonomamag.com/movies/|website = Sonoma Magazine|accessdate = January 9, 2016|language = en-US|date = January 2016|last = Daly|first = James}}</ref> Due to the scenic and varied aspects of [[Sonoma County]], a large number of films have been made within this County. Some of the earliest U.S. filmmaking occurred in Sonoma County such as the 1914 production 1914 ''Salomy Jane'' and ''[[Bronco Billy Anderson]]'' produced in 1915. Many of these films are classics in American [[cinematography]] such as the 1947 film ''[[The Farmer's Daughter (1947 film)|The Farmer's Daughter]]'', starring [[Joseph Cotten]] and [[Loretta Young]], and [[Alfred Hitchcock]]'s ''[[The Birds (film)|The Birds]]'' produced in 1963, which was also partially filmed in adjacent [[Marin County]]. Many other more modern classics have used Sonoma County as a filming venue, including the 1990 production of the ''[[Flatliners]]'' and the 1992 film ''[[Basic Instinct]]''. A few of the other representative films produced partially in Sonoma County are: [[File:McDonald Mansion, 1015 McDonald Ave., Santa Rosa, CA 7-3-2010 1-51-49 PM.JPG|thumb|[[McDonald Mansion]], Santa Rosa, exterior used in 1960's ''[[Pollyanna]]'']]
==Representative film locations== [[File:WashoeHouseEdit2675.jpg|thumb|[[Washoe House]], Petaluma, used in ''[[True Crime (1999 film)|True Crime]] (1999)]] [[File:Kunde Winery, Fall 2012.jpg|thumb|[[Kunde Winery]], used in ''[[Bottle Shock]] (2008)]] {| |valign="top"| ''Sonoma County has hosted several major motion picture films:'' *1915 ''[[Bronco Billy Anderson]]'' - The only one of Anderson's 400 short westerns. *1965 ''[[The Third Day]]'' - *1972 ''[[Images (film)|Images]]'' - US/UK Filmed mostly in Ireland. *1977 ''[[Heroes (1977 film)|Heroes]]'' - *1977 ''Mr. Billion'' - *1986 ''[[Peggy Sue Got Married (film)|Peggy Sue Got Married]]'' - Many scenes of downtown Petaluma, especially Washington St., made over to resemble the 1950s, and exterior and interior shots of [[Santa Rosa High School (Santa Rosa, California)|Santa Rosa High School]]. *1993 ''[[Nowhere to Run (1993 film)|Nowhere to Run]]'' - Coleman Valley Road, Occidental, for farmhouse and pond scenes. *1996 ''[[Phenomenon (film)|Phenomenon]]'' - Santa Rosa Junior College. *2001 ''[[The Man Who Wasn't There (2001 film)|The Man Who Wasn't There]]'' - *2001 ''[[Bandits]]'' - Flamingo Hotel; Clover milk truck featuring local icon ''"Clo the cow"''; and rural County roads (also [[Marin County]])
'''Asti''' *1973 "[[Steel Arena (film)|Steel Arena]]" - Schoolhouse and store
'''Bodega''' *1963 ''[[The Birds (film)|The Birds]]'' - Church and schoolhouse (also [[Marin County]])
'''Cazadero''' *1993 ''[[The Beverly Hillbillies (film)|The Beverly Hillbillies]]''
'''Cloverdale''' *1955 ''[[Many Rivers to Cross]]'' - *1993 ''[[So I Married an Axe Murderer]]'' - Cloverdale Airport (also [[San Francisco]] and [[Alcatraz]]).
'''Cotati''' *1947 ''[[The Farmer's Daughter (1947 film)|The Farmer's Daughter]]'' - Penngrove and Cotati. *1990 ''[[Flatliners]]'' - (also [[Los Angeles]], Chicago Museum of Science and Industry).<ref>[https://www.imdb.com/title/tt0099582/locations Flatliners filming locations]</ref>
'''Glen Ellen''' *1982 ''[[Shoot the Moon]]'' - Glen Ellen and Jack London's [[Wolf House]] (also Marin County). *2008 ''[[Bottle Shock]]'' -
'''Healdsburg''' *1996 ''[[Scream (1996 film)|Scream (film)]]'' - Healdsburg Plaza, Healdsburg City Hall (also [[Glen Ellen, California|Glen Ellen]], [[Santa Rosa, California|Santa Rosa]], and [[Sonoma, California|Sonoma]]) *1999 ''[[Mumford (film)]]''
'''Occidental''' *1993 ''[[Nowhere to Run (1993 film)|Nowhere to Run]]'' - Taylor Lane and Occidental with farmhouse and pond scenes.
'''Penngrove''' *1947 ''[[The Farmer's Daughter (1947 film)|The Farmer's Daughter]]'' - Penngrove and Cotati. |valign="top"| '''Petaluma''' *1973 "[[American Graffiti]]"- Drag race scene near the end of the movie *1984 ''[[Impulse (1984 film)|Impulse]]'' - Farm sequences filmed in Petaluma. *1986 ''[[Howard the Duck (film)|Howard the Duck]]'' Flight scenes with Petaluma Bridge. *1997 " Inventing The Abbotts " Downtown scenes. They brought in a snow machine. *1999 ''[[True Crime (1999 film)|True Crime]]'' - The [[Washoe House]] restaurant on Stony Point Road *''See also:'' [[Petaluma, California#Film locations|Petaluma]]
'''Rohnert Park''' *1992 ''[[Basic Instinct]]'' - Petaluma and Rohnert Park (also [[Carmel, California|Carmel]] and San Francisco) *1994 ''[[Getting Even With Dad]]'' - Rohnert Park Scandia Fun Center *2009 ''[[Biggest Loser]]'' -Rohnert Park, at the [[Rancho Cotate High School]] football field, and in the gym.
'''Russian River''' *1914 ''Salomy Jane'' - Guerneville, Monte Rio (also Marin County, near [[Mount Tamalpais]]). *1925 ''[[Braveheart (1925 film)|Braveheart]]'' - Along the river. *1942 ''[[Holiday Inn (film)|Holiday Inn]]'' - Village Inn Lodge in Monte Rio as the "Holiday Inn" with tons of artificial snow.
'''Sebastopol''' *1949 ''[[Thieves' Highway]]'' - Gold Ridge Road. *1985 ''[[Smooth Talk]]'' - Sebastopol, Gravenstein Highway and Santa Rosa. *1996 ''[[Phenomenon (film)|Phenomenon]]'' - Blank Road. *1999 ''[[Mumford (film)|Mumford]]'' - Sebastopol, Analy High School. *2017 ''[[13 Reasons Why]]'' - Sebastopol, Analy High School.
'''Santa Rosa''' 2003. S.W.A.T. (End of Movie where private plane gets hijacked - @ Sonoma County Airport /"Charles Schulz Airport") - ''See: ''[[Santa Rosa, Larkfield , Windsor ,Wikiup California#Film locations]]
'''Sonoma''' *1973 ''[[American Graffiti]]'' - Schellville along Highway 121 between Napa and Petaluma.<ref>{{cite web | work=PETALUMA CELEBRATES AMERICAN GRAFFITI |title=Behind the Scenes of American Graffiti |url=http://www.american-graffiti-salute.com/movie_behind-the-scenes.html |accessdate=2006-10-24}}</ref> *1978 ''[[The Magic of Lassie]]'' - Hop Kiln Winery. *1988 ''[[Tucker: The Man and His Dream]]'' - Sonoma (also Oakland, San Bruno, San Francisco, and Marin). *1996 ''[[Scream (1996 film)|Scream]]'' - Sonoma Community Center on East Napa Street.<ref>{{cite news |first=Peter |last=Stack |title=FILM REVIEW -- Satirical `Scream' Is Out for Blood -- and Lots of It |work=San Francisco Chronicle |url=http://www.sfgate.com/cgi-bin/article.cgi?f=/c/a/1996/12/20/DD42123.DTL |date=1996-12-20 |accessdate=2007-01-27}}</ref> *2001 ''[[The Animal]]'' - Sonoma City Hall as Police Headquarters; Historic Plaza. *2008 "[[Bottle Shock]]"- Sonoma Plaza and Duhig Road (road labeled "To Davis"), [[Kunde Winery]]. |}
==See also== *[[Santa Rosa, California#Film locations|Film locations in Santa Rosa, California]]
==References== {{reflist}}
[[Category:Culture in the San Francisco Bay Area]] [[Category:Cinema of the United States]] [[Category:Tourist attractions in Sonoma County, California]] [[Category:Films shot in California]]

{{For|the music genre|Footwork (genre)}} {{Unreferenced|auto=yes|date=December 2009}} '''Footwork''' refers to [[dance]] technique aspects related to feet: '''foot position''' and '''foot action'''.
The following aspects of footwork may be considered: *Dance technique: a proper footwork may be vital for proper posture and movement of a dancer. *[[Aesthetic]] value: some foot positions and actions are traditionally considered appealing, while other ones are ugly, although this depends on the culture. *Artistic expression: a sophisticated footwork may in itself be the goal of the dance expression.
Different dances place different emphasis on the above aspects.
==Ballroom dancing== In a narrow sense, e.g., in descriptions of [[ballroom dancing|ballroom]] [[dance figure]]s, the term refers to the behavior of the foot when it meets the floor. In particular, it describes which part of the foot is in contact with the floor: ball, heel, flat, toe, high toe, inside/outside edge, etc.
==B-boying== In [[breakdance]], moves performed on one's hands and feet may be referred to as ''[[downrock]]'' or (especially in the southern United States) as ''footwork''. Typical moves in this type of dance include the "6-step", "2-step", "3-step", "5-step", "coffee grinders", "Valdez", "C-C's", and "front C-C's". Additionally in breakdancing there exists moves specifically known as footwork which place emphasis on one's foot movement. Examples of such moves include the Indian step, Salsa step, and Crossovers.
==See also== *[[Glossary of partner dance terms]] *[[Glossary of ballet terms]] *[[Rises and falls]]
{{DEFAULTSORT:Footwork (Dance)}} [[Category:Dance moves]]
{{Dance-stub}}

revision.text:
[[File:Ganja State Drama Theatre.JPG|thumb|288x288px|Ganja State Drama Theatre]]{{Infobox theater|name=Ganja State Drama Theater|native_name=Gəncə Dövlət Dram Teatrı|location=Azerbaijan, Ganja|built=1980s}}
'''Ganja State Drama Theater '''({{lang-az|Gəncə Dövlət Dram Teatrı}}) is a theater in Azerbaijani.
== History == Ganja State Drama Theater ({{lang-az|Gəncə Dövlət Dram Teatrı}}) was built by the German entrepreneur Christopher Forer in the 80's of the 19th century. In 1899, the building called "Theater" was given to amateur actors. In 1899, a building was given to amateur actors which they called “Theater”. In 1906 a theater troupe "Ganja Muslim Drama Assembly" was created.<ref>{{Cite web|url=http://azteatr.musigi-dunya.az/file?id=88&dt=48|title=Gəncə Dövlət Dram Teatrı|last=|first=|date=|website=|archive-url=|archive-date=|dead-url=|access-date=}}</ref>
The theater`s first building belongs to the 19<sup>th</sup> century. First Ganja State Drama Theater was established on November 13, 1921 in Baku. The Theater operated with the name “Tənqid-təbliğ” (Criticism-propaganda) as of 1925. But then the name of the Theatre was changed into “Bakı-işçi-kəndli” (Baku-worker-villager). In December 1932, the Theater moved to Ganja with all its staff and continued its activities here. Among the actors who came to Ganja were Ismail Talibli, Alasgar Alekperov, [[Aghasadyg Garaybeyli|Aghasadig Garaybeyly]], Aghahuseyn Javadov, Mehdi Mammadov, Kazim Ziya, [[Fatma Gadri]], Amir Dadashli and Razmiya Veysalova. In 1933 an actor studio was created at the Theater. Also, the Department for Young Spectators was organized within the troupe. <ref>{{Cite web|url=https://www.kino-teatr.ru/teatr/686/|title=ГЯНДЖИНСКИЙ ДРАМАТИЧЕСКИЙ ТЕАТР|last=|first=|date=|website=|archive-url=|archive-date=|dead-url=|access-date=}}</ref><ref>{{Cite web|url=https://books.google.az/books?id=xF0MAQAAMAAJ&q=%D0%93%D1%8F%D0%BD%D0%B4%D0%B6%D0%B8%D0%BD%D1%81%D0%BA%D0%B8%D0%B9+%D0%B3%D0%BE%D1%81%D1%83%D0%B4%D0%B0%D1%80%D1%81%D1%82%D0%B2%D0%B5%D0%BD%D0%BD%D1%8B%D0%B9+%D0%B4%D1%80%D0%B0%D0%BC%D0%B0%D1%82%D0%B8%D1%87%D0%B5%D1%81%D0%BA%D0%B8%D0%B9+%D1%82%D0%B5%D0%B0%D1%82%D1%80&dq=%D0%93%D1%8F%D0%BD%D0%B4%D0%B6%D0%B8%D0%BD%D1%81%D0%BA%D0%B8%D0%B9+%D0%B3%D0%BE%D1%81%D1%83%D0%B4%D0%B0%D1%80%D1%81%D1%82%D0%B2%D0%B5%D0%BD%D0%BD%D1%8B%D0%B9+%D0%B4%D1%80%D0%B0%D0%BC%D0%B0%D1%82%D0%B8%D1%87%D0%B5%D1%81%D0%BA%D0%B8%D0%B9+%D1%82%D0%B5%D0%B0%D1%82%D1%80&hl=en&sa=X&ved=0ahUKEwivjZyy96reAhVrp4sKHUmqAXcQ6AEIKDAA|title=История советского драматического театра|last=|first=|date=|website=|archive-url=|archive-date=|dead-url=|access-date=}}</ref>
In October 2014 the foundation of new building of Ganja State Drama Theater was laid within the framework of Presidential Decree. 3 million manat was allocated to the construction of the building. The new building with 13 thousand square meters is located on the bank of Ganja River.<ref>{{Cite web|url=https://azertag.az/en/xeber/803912|title=President Ilham Aliyev attended a ceremony to lay the foundation of Ganja state Drama Theatre|last=|first=|date=|website=|archive-url=|archive-date=|dead-url=|access-date=}}</ref><ref>{{Cite web|url=https://en.trend.az/azerbaijan/politics/2323478.html|title=Azerbaijani president attends foundation laying ceremony of Ganja State Drama Theatre|last=|first=|date=|website=|archive-url=|archive-date=|dead-url=|access-date=}}</ref>
== Festivals == The Ganja State Drama Theater participated in the V International Theater Festival that held in September 2012 in the city of Ufa in [[Bashkortostan]]. The theater performed the performance "Monsieur Jordan and Dervish Mastali Shah" of [[Mirza Fatali Akhundov|Mirza Fatali Akhundzadeh]].<ref>{{Cite web|url=https://azertag.az/xeber/Gence_Dovlet_Dram_Teatrinin_kollektivi_beynelxalq_festivalin_I_dereceli_diplomuna_layiq_gorulmusdur-186793|title=Gəncə Dövlət Dram Teatrının kollektivi beynəlxalq festivalın I dərəcəli diplomuna layiq görülmüşdür|last=|first=|date=|website=|archive-url=|archive-date=|dead-url=|access-date=}}</ref><ref>{{Cite web|url=https://ru.sputnik.az/culture/20120720/297626546.html|title=Кумыкский театр представит спектакль азербайджанского драматурга на фестивале «Туганлык» в Уфе.|last=|first=|date=|website=|archive-url=|archive-date=|dead-url=|access-date=}}</ref>
In May 2016 the Theater joined festival that held in Ukraine presenting the performance on piece of work by [[Jalil Mammadguluzadeh|Jalil Mammadguluzade]] "The congregation of madmen."<ref name=":0">{{Cite web|url=https://report.az/en/art/ganja-theater-will-take-part-in-festival-in-ukraine/|title=Ganja theater to attend a festival in Ukraine|last=|first=|date=|website=|archive-url=|archive-date=|dead-url=|access-date=}}</ref>
In the same year the Ganja State Drama Theatre also attended International Festival held in the city of Konya of Turkey with Elchin`s play "Killer" and performance on Turgay Nar`s play “Game of Shahrazad”.<ref name=":0" />
In July 2018 the Ganja State Drama Theater took part in the 2nd International Theater Festival dedicated to the memory of popular Georgian writer Nodar Dumbadze in Georgia. Ganja State Drama Theater staged the story Helados.<ref>{{Cite web|url=https://www.azernews.az/culture/134349.html|title=Ganja State Drama Theater to join international festival in Georgia|last=|first=|date=|website=|archive-url=|archive-date=|dead-url=|access-date=}}</ref><ref>{{Cite web|url=https://azertag.az/en/xeber/230784|title=Azeri theatre troupe to go on tour to Turkey, Ukraine, Russia|last=|first=|date=|website=|archive-url=|archive-date=|dead-url=|access-date=}}</ref>
== See also == * [[Theatre in Azerbaijan]]
== References == {{reflist}}
